titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1623_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1623_01

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.son of Yadaʿʾab 2.[.]myānum, has offered 3.an eagle made from ṣlf[ʿ] 4.[..] and he dedicated it.
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Yadaʿʾīl Bayyin, king of Ḥaḍramōt,] son of Yadaʿʾab 2.[Ghaylān, king of Ḥaḍramōt, of the lineage of ʾA]myānum, has offered] 3.[and consecrated to] his lord, Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm, (this statue of)] an eagle made from ṣlf[ʿ,] 4.[an eagle which had c]ome to him from the nor]th, and he dedicated it.

Restored full text of the inscription:
<lb n="1"/><supplied reason="lost">Yadaʿʾīl Bayyin, king of Ḥaḍramōt,</supplied> son of Yadaʿʾab <lb n="2"/><supplied reason="lost">Ghaylān, king of Ḥaḍramōt, of the lineage of ʾA</supplied>myānum, has offered</supplied> <lb n="3"/><supplied reason="lost">and consecrated to</supplied> his lord, Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm, <unclear>this statue of</unclear></supplied> an eagle made from ṣlf<supplied reason="lost">ʿ,</supplied> <lb n="4"/><supplied reason="lost">an eagle which had c</supplied>ome to him from the nor</supplied>th, and he dedicated it.</ab>

div.tei:ab:
Text preserved in this squeeze:
son of Yadaʿʾab
.myānum, has offered
an eagle made from ṣlfʿ
.. and he dedicated it.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾīl Bayyin, king of Ḥaḍramōt, son of Yadaʿʾab
Ghaylān, king of Ḥaḍramōt, of the lineage of ʾAmyānum, has offered
and consecrated to his lord, Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm, this statue of an eagle made from ṣlfʿ,
an eagle which had come to him from the north, and he dedicated it.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
son of Yadaʿʾab
.myānum, has offered
an eagle made from ṣlfʿ
.. and he dedicated it.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾīl Bayyin, king of Ḥaḍramōt, son of Yadaʿʾab
Ghaylān, king of Ḥaḍramōt, of the lineage of ʾAmyānum, has offered
and consecrated to his lord, Siyān Dhū-ʾAlīm, this statue of an eagle made from ṣlfʿ,
an eagle which had come to him from the north, and he dedicated it.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
